	<meta property="og:title" content="Achievements">

	<meta property="og:url" content="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements">

	<meta property="og:description" content="Achievements, also commonly known as Badges, are awards players can obtain in-game or through other means (e.g. &quot;Group Member&quot; by joining the LSPLASH Roblox group). Unlocking an achievement whilst playing the game will show a UI notification on the top right of the player's screen, as well as awarding the player with a badge. In the Lobby, players can display one of their earned achievements above their character. The achievement &quot;Welcome&quot; is displayed by default; the achievement being displayed">

	<meta property="og:image" content="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/4/4c/Achievement.png/revision/latest?cb=20220814204208">

																		<div id="mw-content-text" class="mw-body-content"><!-- Google Tag Manager (noscript) -->

<div class="mw-content-ltr mw-parser-output" lang="en" dir="ltr"><p>
</p><aside role="region" class="portable-infobox pi-background pi-border-color pi-theme-wikia pi-layout-stacked">
<h2 class="pi-item pi-item-spacing pi-title pi-secondary-background" data-source="title">Achievements</h2>

<figure class="pi-item pi-image" data-source="image">
	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/4/4c/Achievement.png/revision/latest?cb=20220814204208" class="image image-thumbnail" title="">
		<img src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/4/4c/Achievement.png/revision/latest?cb=20220814204208" class="pi-image-thumbnail" data-relevant="1" alt="" width="256" height="256" data-image-key="Achievement.png" data-image-name="Achievement.png">
		
	</a>
	<figcaption class="pi-item-spacing pi-caption">The icon for Achievements, used for the button in the lobby.</figcaption>
</figure>
<section class="pi-item pi-group pi-border-color">
	<h2 class="pi-item pi-header pi-secondary-font pi-item-spacing pi-secondary-background">INFORMATION</h2>

<div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="type">
	
		<h3 class="pi-data-label pi-secondary-font">Type</h3>
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font">Accomplishment Mechanic</div>
</div>

<div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="usage">
	
		<h3 class="pi-data-label pi-secondary-font">Usage</h3>
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font">Awards a Roblox badge.</div>
</div>

</section>
<section class="pi-item pi-group pi-border-color pi-collapse pi-collapse-closed">
	<h2 class="pi-item pi-header pi-secondary-font pi-item-spacing pi-secondary-background">SOUND FILES</h2>

<div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="sound1">
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font"><ul><li><b>Getting the Achievement</b></li></ul><p><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File"><audio src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/e/ea/AchievementGetWavePass.mp3/revision/latest?cb=20230919160339" width="180" class="mw-file-element" style="max-width: 100%; width: 180px;" controls=""><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/File:AchievementGetWavePass.mp3">https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/File:AchievementGetWavePass.mp3</a></audio></span></p></div>
</div>

</section>
</aside>

<p></p>
<blockquote class="quote">
<table style="width:auto">
<tbody><tr>
<td rowspan="2" style="color:#D0AE82; font-family:Sans-Serif; font-size:470%; vertical-align:middle"><span typeof="mw:File"><span><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="100" height="100" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="Speech.png" data-image-key="Speech.png" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/f/f9/Speech.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/100?cb=20241017141729"></span></span>
</td>
<td style="padding-left:20px; padding-top:13px"><i>"Requires "Detour""<br>- The <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Curious_Light" title="Curious Light">Curious Light</a> barrier that blocks <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Backdoor" title="The Backdoor">The Backdoor</a>, found in the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Lobby" title="Lobby">Lobby</a>.</i>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
</blockquote>
<p><b>Achievements</b>, also commonly known as <b>Badges</b>, are awards <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Player" class="mw-redirect" title="Player">players</a> can obtain in-game or through other means (e.g. "Group Member" by joining the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/LSPLASH" title="LSPLASH">LSPLASH</a> Roblox group). Unlocking an <i>achievement</i> whilst playing the game will show a UI notification on the top right of the player's screen, as well as awarding the player with a <i>badge</i>. 
</p><p>In the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Lobby" title="Lobby">Lobby</a>, players can display one of their earned <i>achievements</i> above their character. The <i>achievement</i> "Welcome" is displayed by default; the <i>achievement</i> being displayed can be changed via the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Game_Settings" title="Game Settings">Game Settings</a>. Each <i>achievement</i> or category of <i>achievements</i> has a unique text color that represents the displayed achievement rarity or difficulty when being displayed. A total of 94 <i>achievements</i> are in the game, when classified into the 8 categories, are: 20 "General", 24 "Entities", 25 "Crucifix," 11 "Floors," 5 "Collabs," 5 "Events," 2 "removed", and 2 hidden "<i>achievements</i>" ("QA Tester and&nbsp;???"), with the QA Tester badge being exclusive to game testers.
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none"><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Rewards"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Currency" title="Currency"><img alt="Currency" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="24" height="24" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="CURRENCY.png" data-image-key="CURRENCY.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/b/bb/CURRENCY.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/24?cb=20241020000145"></a></span> Rewards</span></h2>
<p>Some <i>badges</i> give a reward, like Knobs and/or Revives, for obtaining them.
</p>
<ul><li>These <i>badges</i>, as of now, are: "Group Member", "Tower Hero", "True Tower Hero", "Hotel Adventurer", "Void Buster", "Sugar Rush", "Sugar Crash" and "You're It".</li></ul>
<table class="fandom-table">
<tbody><tr>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Bugs"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><span title="Bugs"><img alt="Bugs" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="24" height="22" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="Bug.svg" data-image-key="Bug.svg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/1/1d/Bug.svg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/24?cb=20250323140846"></span></span> Bugs</span></h2>
<ul><li>When <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Mines" title="The Mines">The Mines</a> was released, the "Trespassing" <i>badge</i> was obtained when starting <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Nest" title="The Nest">The Nest</a>. This was fixed after the nerf.</li>
<li>"In Plain Sight" <i>achievement</i> is not obtainable by hiding from A-60 or A-120 without a hiding spot using the "Room For More" modifier and in <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Rooms" title="The Rooms">The Rooms</a>.</li>
<li>The "Unbound" <i>achievement</i> is unobtainable by using a <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Crucifix" title="Crucifix">Crucifix</a> on <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Ambush" title="Ambush">Ambush</a> using the "Again &amp; Again &amp; Again" modifier.</li>
<li>The "Meet Jack" <i>achievement</i> was only obtainable for meeting <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Jack" title="Jack">Bloodroom Jack</a>, and meeting Closet <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Jack" title="Jack">Jack</a> didn't give the achievement, from August 30, 2024, to October 24, 2024.</li>
<li>The "Rebound" <i>achievement</i> was broken and unobtainable after <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Update_Logs#August" title="Update Logs">August 26, 2023</a> (the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Modifiers" title="Modifiers">Modifiers</a> Update). Since then, it has been fixed.</li>
<li>The "Wrong Room" <i>achievement</i> is usually not obtainable and only rarely gets granted from opening a <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Dupe" title="Dupe">Dupe</a> door. The exact conditions to get it are still currently unknown.
<ul><li>The <i>badge</i> can be obtained if a Crucifix is used on it, giving the player both the "Wrong Room" and "Outwitted" <i>badges</i>. Until now this is the only possible way.</li></ul></li>
<li>The Sshh! <i>achievement</i> was unobtainable even if no drawers were opened and <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Library" title="The Library">The Library</a> was completed from September 1, 2024, to September 17, 2024. This was later fixed.
<ul><li>This bug then recurred after Floor 2 was released, though that has also been fixed.</li></ul></li>
<li>When the Content Update released, 4 of the new badges didn't have icons, though this has been fixed. Those achievements are as follows: Trial and Error, Playtime, Rocky Road and A Hard Place.
<ul><li>When the Content Update released, "A Hard Place" had the same outer frame color as the "Not Five Stars" and "Rocky Road" achievements (yellow-purple).</li></ul></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Trivia"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><span title="Trivia"><img alt="Trivia" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="24" height="24" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="TRIVIA.png" data-image-key="TRIVIA.png" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/d/da/TRIVIA.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/24?cb=20241013143648"></span></span> Trivia</span></h2>
<ul><li><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Lightning_Splash" title="Lightning Splash">LSPLASH</a> has said in a Q&amp;A that some achievement icons might get updated soon, as some icons are either outdated, a reused picture from another icon achievement or a screenshot from an earlier trailer.<sup><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources" style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i>citation needed</i>]</span></sup></li>
<li>All of the <i>achievement</i> titles as seen in-game roughly indicate the difficulty of obtaining the badge, displayed in the table below.</li></ul>
<table class="fandom-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed">
<tbody><tr>
<th>Color</th>
<th>Example image</th>
<th>Meaning</th>
<th>Achievement list
</th></tr>

</td>

<tr>

<td style="background:linear-gradient(to bottom,#D3A77D,#C7712F)"><center>Orange</center>

<td><div style="border-radius: 100%; padding: 3px; background: linear-gradient(to bottom,#D3A77D,#C7712F)"><div style="border-radius: 100%; background: transparent;"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/5/54/Hotel_Adventurer_Badge.png/revision/latest?cb=20230722212749" class="mw-file-description image"><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="143" height="143" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="Hotel Adventurer Badge.png" data-image-key="Hotel_Adventurer_Badge.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/5/54/Hotel_Adventurer_Badge.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/143?cb=20230722212749"></a></span></div></div>
</td>
<td>Completing The Hotel on Adventure Mode in the Tower Heroes x DOORS Event
</td>
<td>
<ul><li>Hotel Adventurer</li></ul>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td style="background:linear-gradient(to bottom,#E6E1E1,#3D3B3E)"><center>Gray-Dark-Gray</center>
</td>
<td><div style="border-radius: 100%; padding: 3px; background: linear-gradient(to bottom,#E6E1E1,#3D3B3E)"><div style="border-radius: 100%; background: transparent;"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/7/7d/Void_Buster_Badge.png/revision/latest?cb=20230722212747" class="mw-file-description image"><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="143" height="143" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="Void Buster Badge.png" data-image-key="Void_Buster_Badge.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/7/7d/Void_Buster_Badge.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/143?cb=20230722212747"></a></span></div></div>
</td>
<td>Defeating Void in the Tower Heroes x DOORS Event
</td>
<td>
<ul><li>Void Buster</li></ul>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<ul><li>There was originally going to be a "Thousand of Many" death <i>badge</i>, though it was scrapped as it would be unlikely that anybody would obtain it without purposefully dying.</li>
<li>A total of 8 <i>achievements</i> can be obtained without playing a single run of any <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Floors" title="Floors">floor</a> (Welcome, Welcome Back, Join The Group, Tower Hero, True Tower Hero, Hotel Adventurer, Void Buster, and You're It). This would require joining the game on two different days, joining the LSPLASH Group, fully completing the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Tower_Heroes_Event" class="mw-redirect" title="Tower Heroes Event">Tower Heroes Event</a>, and playing one round in <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Courtyard" title="The Courtyard">The Courtyard</a> map during the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Untitled_Tag_Game_Collab" title="Untitled Tag Game Collab">Untitled Tag Game Collab</a>.
<ul><li>However, a total of 56 <i>achievements</i> can be obtained by only playing one round, with an extremely low chance due to crucifix spawns.</li></ul></li>
<li>The "In Plain Sight" <i>badge</i>'s original icon got content deleted. LSPLASH thought this was because of the Roblox character looking naked in the icon, so they gave them fake doors merch in the icon.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_note-3"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>3<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>As of now, it is only possible to obtain Red Mist, Stop Right There, Grin Reaper, "Time Out", "Blue Light" and "Lookman No Looking" by activating the Room For More", Blitz, Oh", "Make Haste" and "Look, Man" <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Modifiers" title="Modifiers">modifiers</a> on either The Hotel or The Mines.
<ul><li>Although it is possible to encounter and even obtain the "Lookman No Looking" <i>achievement</i> by activating the "Trick or Treat" Modifier, then eating a candy with the "Look, Man" effect, after which the entity can be crucified.</li></ul></li>
<li>It was confirmed by <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Ghostly_Wowzers" title="Ghostly Wowzers">Ghostly Wowzers</a> that entities such as <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Guiding_Light" title="Guiding Light">Guiding Light</a>, <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Sally" title="Sally">Sally</a> (Window), and <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Shadow" title="Shadow">Shadow</a> will never receive in-game <i>achievements</i>.
<ul><li>However, in the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Update_Logs" title="Update Logs">Content Update</a>, <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Sally" title="Sally">Sally</a> was updated with more functionality and was given two <i>badges</i>, so this statement is outdated.</li></ul></li>
<li>There are two versions of the "Rock Bottom" <i>badge</i> (although they are treated as the same <i>badge</i> in-game): one that was obtainable before the Hotel+ Update, and one that is obtainable after the Hotel+ Update.)</li>
<li>The "Survival The Jeff the Killer" <i>badge</i> has for some reason two different icons, with one being the original image of Jeff the Killer, which appears in its UI notification and when a player displays the <i>badge</i> on the lobby (both examples seen below). The second one is an image with black static, which can be seen on the Roblox website.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_note-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>The image used for the "Group Member" <i>badge</i> is the same icon as the Fandom account of <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/User:LSplashYeet" title="User:LSplashYeet">LSplashYeet</a>.</li>
<li>Void Buster is the first secret <i>achievement</i> and most likely last as there probably won't be any more secret achievements.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_note-5"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>5<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>The icon for the <i>badge</i> "Not Five Stars" uses <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/El_Goblino" title="El Goblino">El Goblino</a>'s Tower Heroes model instead of his official one in game.
<ul><li>The icon shows a different viewpoint of the laptop used in <a target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="text" href="https://towerheroes.fandom.com/wiki/File:Doors_UI_Modifier.png">Tower Heroes's modifier "Doors UI"</a>.</li></ul></li>
<li>The "Survival The Jeff The Killer" <i>badge</i>'s name used to be "?????" with a description of "erm guys? theres a new <i>badge</i>? look!! look!!".</li>
<li>The "Hotel Hell" <i>badge</i> image uses the same model of Seek as the "Take A Breather" <i>achievement</i> image.</li>
<li>In an old teaser of the settings menu, a <i>badge</i> called "Dead Of Night" can be seen above LSPLASH's avatar. This badge went unused, but was later re-added.
<ul><li>It is thought that this was for <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Dread" title="Dread">Dread</a> before it was removed. Although, Dread was later added back in the DOORS x The Hunt update but did not come with the <i>badge</i>. With Floor 2 being released, however, it has been added back, along with a Crucifix <i>achievement</i> for Dread.</li></ul></li>
<li>Jack's <i>badge</i> icon has the same background as Rock Bottom, but significantly darker.</li>
<li>Multiple other <i>badges</i> can be seen in the background of the "Buddy System" badge.
<ul><li>A blurred version of the "Welcome" badge appears to be in the background.</li>
<li>Halt's eyes are in the background of the <i>badge</i>, and they seem to be copied from Halt's own <i>badge</i>, "Two Steps Forward".</li>
<li>While hard to notice, the "Rock Bottom" <i>badge</i> is also overlaid with the background as well.</li></ul></li>
<li>The "Rock Bottom" and "See You Soon" <i>badges</i> can be obtained even when spectating someone else beating <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Hotel" class="mw-redirect" title="Hotel">The Hotel</a> and <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Mines" title="The Mines">The Mines</a> respectively. Same goes with "Not Five Stars", "Hotel Hell", "Rocky Road" and "A Hard Place" <i>badges</i>.
<ul><li>Including if <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Players" title="Players">you</a> ate the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Candy" title="Candy">candy</a> <i>Run from it</i> <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Dread" title="Dread">Dread</a> kills you. (if you ate the candy before the final cutscene)
<ul><li>Including <i>Psst...</i> <i>Room for more?</i>, <i>Can-die</i> and more (and Candies that make damage if less of 5-40)</li></ul></li></ul></li>
<li>If one player in a group escapes the Rooms, all players are awarded with the Back On Track <i>badge</i>, even if they died in the Rooms.
<ul><li>This is likely because all players are revived when entering/leaving the Rooms, and the <i>achievement</i> is awarded when re-entering The Hotel.</li></ul></li>
<li>The 10 rarest <i>achievements</i> as of March 3, 2025, are:</li></ul>
<ol><li>A Hard Place (21,559 owners)</li>
<li>Grin Reaper (27,794 owners)</li>
<li>Rocky Road (31,289 owners)</li>
<li>Red Mist (41,095 owners)</li>
<li>Time Out (60,511 owners)</li>
<li>Void Buster (66,374 owners)</li>
<li>Stop Right There (72,425 owners)</li>
<li>Red Light (73,014 owners)</li>
<li>Lookman No Looking (75,150 owners)</li>
<li>Survival The Jeff The Killer (77,600 owners)</li></ol>
<ul><li>The font used for <i>achievements</i> in-game (not in the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Lobby" title="Lobby">Lobby</a>'s "Achievements" tab) is most likely the "Bahnschrift SemiLight Condensed".</li>
<li>The majority of the crucifixion <i>badges</i> seem to involve the entity in the entity-specific badge to be in what seems to be a state of fear.</li>
<li>Scammed, Take A Breather and All Figured Out are the only crucifix achievements which have a bright image.</li>
<li>The "Survival the Jeff the Killer" <i>badge</i> is slightly larger than the other <i>badge</i> icons when being shown at the top of the in-game achievement menu.</li>
<li>Some <i>Badges</i> have outdated Icons, those being Welcome and Welcome Back (due to having an older version of the lobby), Expert Technician (due to having the old electrical room [?]), Two Steps Forward (due to having the old Halt's hallway), Meet Jack (due to having an older version of Jack) and Sshh! (due to having the old library).
<ul><li>However, <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/LSPLASH" title="LSPLASH">LSPLASH</a> said that in a future update he is going to update said outdated icons.<sup><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources" style="white-space: nowrap;">[<i>citation needed</i>]</span></sup></li></ul></li>
<li>The "Flyswatter" <i>achievement</i>'s name was changed to "Bug Bomb", which is still obtained by crucifying <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Gloombats" title="Gloombats">Gloombats</a>.
<ul><li>On Roblox, the badge is still referred to as "Flyswatter".</li></ul></li></ul>
<ul><li>Hardstuck is the first <i>achievement</i> to have multiple variations and serial numbers, with 5 in total.</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cultural_References">Cultural References</span></h3>
<ul><li><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Eyes" title="Eyes">Eyes</a>' <i>achievement</i> description, "Last chance to look at me", is a reference to a line spoken by <a href="https://breakingbad.fandom.com/wiki/Gustavo_Fring" class="extiw" title="w:c:breakingbad:Gustavo Fring">Gustavo Fring</a> in a scene between him and rival <a href="https://breakingbad.fandom.com/wiki/Hector_Salamanca" class="extiw" title="w:c:breakingbad:Hector Salamanca">Hector Salamanca</a> from a <a href="https://breakingbad.fandom.com/wiki/Face_Off" class="extiw" title="w:c:breakingbad:Face Off">Breaking Bad episode</a> titled "Face Off".
<ul><li>Their <i>achievement</i> icon also features more eyes than the entity has, with a total of 60 eyes. This is because the image of Eyes was duplicated and added to the corners of the achievement icon.</li></ul></li>
<li>The description for the "Sshh!" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to the "<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://youtu.be/PfYnvDL0Qcw">We are Number One</a>" meme.</li>
<li><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Rush" title="Rush">Rush</a>'s <i>achievement</i> description, "I'm walkin' here!" is a reference to a line from the film "<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://youtu.be/c412hqucHKw">Midnight Cowboy</a>".
<ul><li>This description can appear when <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Rush" title="Rush">Rush</a> is about to pass a room if <i><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/April_Fools_2024" class="mw-redirect" title="April Fools 2024">Voice</a> <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Modifiers" title="Modifiers">Acting</a></i> is active saying: <i>CAN'T YOU SEE I'M WALKIN' HERE!?</i>.</li></ul></li>
<li>Supporting Small Businesses' description may be a reference to Apu's "Thank, you come again." Catchphrase from The Simpsons.</li>
<li>The <i>badge</i> "Pls Donate" is a reference to another Roblox game of the same name.
<ul><li>If the player has this <i>badge</i>, they unlock a booth inside of the Roblox game PLS DONATE styled off the <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Jeff_Shop" title="Jeff Shop">Jeff Shop</a>.</li>
<li>The description for the "Pls Donate" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to the game UNDERTALE, where the protagonist is able to pay to vendor Temmie's college (referred to as "cool leg" or "colleg" by Temmie).</li></ul></li>
<li>The description for "Running Track" is a reference to old Roblox cart ride games, often named "Cart Ride into _____", and some other old Roblox games having "for Free Robux" near the end of the title.</li>
<li><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Timothy" title="Timothy">Timothy</a>'s <i>achievement</i> icon is a reference to a joke between the developers and pre-release testers, where it was commonly requested that any drawers containing Timothy would be covered with webs, although this request always was declined.
<ul><li>Timothy's <i>achievement</i> description, however, is a potential reference to an action in <a href="https://henrystickmin.fandom.com/wiki/The_Henry_Stickmin_Collection" class="extiw" title="w:c:henrystickmin:The Henry Stickmin Collection">The Henry Stickmin Collection</a>'s 4th 'episode', Infiltrating the Airship, where during the Government Supported Private Investigator route, Henry attempts to <a href="https://henrystickmin.fandom.com/wiki/Spook" class="extiw" title="w:c:henrystickmin:Spook">spook</a> a clan member with a tiny spider on a stick, but instead to scream or being scared and running, the clan member greeting it warmly, saying "Oh, hello Mr. Spider." before Henry hitting him in the head with the stick being the member dazed and knocked out.</li></ul></li>
<li>The "Error" <i>badge</i> icon is a distorted image of <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Glitch" title="Glitch">Glitch</a> taken from <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://twitter.com/RediblesQW/status/1559615008648085505">this tweet</a>. (0:07)
<ul><li>This is the first ever <i>badge</i> to be modified, as its badge icon went from the infamous <a href="https://roblox.fandom.com/wiki/Content_deletion" class="extiw" title="w:c:roblox:Content deletion">content deleted image</a> to its current one. The description was also changed, with it formerly being "Note to self: stick with the team."
<ul><li>Was changed because many players think the icon was failing to load.</li></ul></li></ul></li>
<li>The <i>badge</i> icons for both the "Take A Breather" and "All Figured Out" are references to memes.
<ul><li>The "Take A Breather" icon is a reference to <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/sparkles-and-champagne-shannon-sharpe-fit-checks">Sparkles and Champagne/Shannon Sharpe Fit Checks</a>.</li>
<li>"All Figured Out" is a reference to <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://knowyourmeme.com/photos/2366096-my-reaction-to-that-information">this image</a>.
<ul><li>They, along with Scammed, are also the only <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Crucifix" title="Crucifix">Crucifix</a>-related <i>achievements</i> that aren't images of the entity shrouded in darkness. This may be because they are not actually banished and are only stuck in place for a moment. However, <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Louie" title="Louie">Louie</a> can be banished upon using a Crucifix on him.
<ul><li>Furthermore, <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Queen_Grumble" title="Queen Grumble">Queen Grumble</a>s <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Crucifix" title="Crucifix">Crucifix</a> <i>badge</i> does not follow this rule, instead being shrouded in darkness like other entities.</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></li>
<li>The Down The Drain icon might be a reference to one of the scenes in <a href="https://terminator.fandom.com/wiki/Terminator" class="extiw" title="w:c:terminator:Terminator">Terminator</a> where he shows a thumbs up while drowning in lava, or an elimination scene in the Polus map from Among Us (which seems to also reference the specific Terminator scene).</li>
<li>The "I Hate You" <i>badge</i> description is a reference to the onion carriage scene in the movie <a href="https://shrek.fandom.com/wiki/Shrek_2" class="extiw" title="w:c:shrek:Shrek 2">Shrek 2</a>.</li>
<li>The "Survival The Jeff the Killer" <i>badge</i> is a reference to a <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://www.roblox.com/games/1612136349/Survival-The-Jeff-The-Killer">popular Roblox game with the same name</a>.
<ul><li>Its description might be a reference to Jeff The Killer's catchphrase, "GO TO SLEEP", because people often have dreams in their sleep.</li></ul></li>
<li>The "Void Buster" <i>badge</i> and description is a reference to the song "Ghostbusters" by Ray Parker Jr.</li>
<li>The "You Finally Turn Green" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to the Smiling Friends episode named "Pim Finally Turns Green".</li>
<li>The description for the "Other Way Around" <i>badge</i> references a scene in The Incredibles where Mr. Incredible says "Yeah, I've got time."</li>
<li>The description of the "Trickshot" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to the SpongeBob episode "Krusty Krab Training Video", in which a brick is thrown at a fish who repeatedly says "Hooplah!</li>
<li>Playtime's name and description may be a reference to Baldi's Basics' Playtime (in which she has the name and catchphrase of both the name and description respectively) or Poppy Playtime.</li>
<li>Playtime's Over's description may be a reference to the Woody's Nightmare scene from Toy Story 2.</li>
<li>The "Queen's Gambit" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to a popular chess opening.</li>
<li>"Two Steps Ahead" is currently being connected to a video of the same name by famous mukbanger Nikocado Avocado, althrough the <i>achievement</i> appeared much earlier.</li>
<li>The "Stop Right There" <i>achievement</i>'s description is a reference to Sans from Undertale explaining blue attacks to the player.</li>
<li>The "Red Mist" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to the famous creepypasta, red mist. The description is a refrence to the "<a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dont-ask-who-joe-is-joe-mama">DON'T ASK WHO JOE IS</a>" meme, which has the previously mentioned red mist squidward staring, with the text "DON'T ASK WHO JOE IS" in all capitals, is put at the top and bottom of the image.</li>
<li>The "Time Out" <i>achievement</i> description could be a reference to "hold up. wait a minute, something ain't right" meme.</li>
<li>The "In Plain Sight" <i>achievement</i> description is a reference to one of <a target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="text" href="https://undertale.fandom.com/wiki/Sans">Sans</a>' lines from Undertale.</li>
<li>The "Lookman No Looking" <i>achievement</i> is a reference to the phrase "Swiper no swiping!" from the TV show Dora the Explorer.
<ul><li>This extends to the <i>achievement'</i>s description.</li></ul></li>
<li>The "Lost In The Dark" <i>achievement</i> description references a vine made by CalebCity.</li>
<li>The Bug Bomb achievement description references a children's song, as the splat, goes the gloombat! Is a reference to the song Pop, goes the weasel.</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><span title="History"><img alt="History" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="24" height="24" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="HISTORY.png" data-image-key="HISTORY.png" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/9/92/HISTORY.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/24?cb=20221022022603"></span></span> History</span></h2>
<div style="overflow-y:scroll; height:150px; width:100%"><div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>August 10, 2022 </b>
<b></b></div><b>On release, 23 badges were added (Welcome, Welcome Back, Buddy System, Back From the Dead, Group Member (formally Join The Group),   Betrayal, Sshh!, Expert Technician, Rock Bottom (Before Hotel+), Out of My Way, Look at Me, Two Step Forward..., You Can Run, Eviction Notice, Meet Jack, Meet Timothy, Rebound, I See You, Error, One of Many, Ten of Many, Hundred of Many). One of these badges (Group Member) gives a free revive as a reward.</b></div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>January 28, 2023</b>
<b></b></div><b>The Hotel+ update added 22 badges. (Interconnected, Herb of Viridis, In Plain Sight, Wrong Room, It Stares Back, Supporting Small Businesses, Pls Donate, Evil Be Gone, Stay Out Of My Way, Unbound, Take A Breather, All Figured Out, You Cant See Me, I Hate You, Two Steps Ahead, Outwitted, Rock Bottom (after Hotel +), Detour, Back On Track, A-1000 (shown as "???" before unlocking it or in the roblox inventory) and QA Tester) and one badge became unobtainable (Rock Bottom (Before Hotel+)</b>
</div><div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>April 1, 2023</b>
<b></b></div><b>the April fools of 2023 introduced SUPER HARD MODE!!! Which only added one badge. (Survival The Jeff The Killer, formerly shown as "?????" when the event first released.)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>April 9, 2023</b>
<b></b></div><b>Survival The Jeff The Killer badge is made unobtainable.</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>July 23, 2023</b>
<b></b></div><b>The Tower Heroes X DOORS collab added four badges, however they are obtained in <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://www.roblox.com/es/games/4646477729/Tower-Heroes-UPDATE">Tower Heroes</a>.  (Tower Hero, True Tower Hero, Hotel Adventurer, Void Buster, This Badges gives as a reward, 100 Knobs (Tower Hero), One Revive and 150 Knobs (True Tower Hero), 1 revive and 100 Knobs (Hotel Adventurer) and 1 Revive with 500 Knobs (Void Buster)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>August 26, 2023</b>
<b></b></div><b>The Modifiers update added two badges. (Not Five Stars and Hotel Hell)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>March 15, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>DOORS participated in THE HUNT event, which added one badge. (THE HUNT: Escape the Backdoor)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>March 30, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>THE HUNT concluded, and added two new badges for escaping <a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/The_Backdoor" title="The Backdoor">The Backdoor</a> post-Hunt update (Other Way Around, and Around Back). THE HUNT badge was also discontinued, also being renamed to "THE HUNT: First Edition" shortly after this.</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>April 1, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>the April Fools of 2024 introduced RETRO MODE Witch only added one badge. (Survive The Drakobloxxers)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>April 10, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>The Survive The Drakobloxxers badge became unobtainable, along with the event ending.</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>August 30, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>The Mines update released, which added 15 new badges. (Whoever Smelt It, Trespassing, I Dont Believe My Eyes, Just A Prank, Trickshot, Helping Hand, Running Track, Down The Drain, It's Not My Time, Flyswatter, Not Funny, Lost in Translation, Dead of Night, The Bigger They Are and See You Soon)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>October 24, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>DOORS participates in the Haunt which added 2 badges (Sugar Rush and Sugar Crash), This Badges give as a Reward 1 Revive and 100 Knobs (Sugar Rush) and 2 Revives with 500 Knobs (Sugar Crash)</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>October 25, 2024</b>
<b></b></div><b>Doors collaborated with "Untitled Tag Game", adding You're It, obtainable only in Untitled Tag Game. This badge gives as a reward 1 revive with 50 Knobs</b>
</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px"><b>December 2, 2024</b></div>Sugar Rush and Sugar Crash became unobtainable</div>
<div class="doors-log" style="padding:1em; border-radius:10px; margin-bottom:10px">
<div style="font-size:20px">'<i><b>December 20, 2024'</b></i></div><b>The Content Update released, which added 19 new badges (You Finally Turn Green, Improvise, Trade Offer, Trial And Error, Playtime, Bug Zapper, Lost In The Dark, Under New Management, Red Mist, Stop Right There, Grin Reaper, Red Light, Lookman No Looking, Time Out, Queen's Gambit, Scammed, Playtime's Over, Rocky Road and A Hard Place). Flyswatter was renamed to "Bug Bomb", and the "The Bigger They Are" achievement icon has been changed as normal Grumbles can be crucified now. Queen Grumble's crucifix icon is the old "The Bigger They Are" icon. Eyes' crucifix achievement description updated to "Stop staring at me with them big ol' eyes!".</b></div></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References"><span typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><span title="Gallery"><img alt="Gallery" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="24" height="24" class="mw-file-element lazyload" data-image-name="GALLERY.png" data-image-key="GALLERY.png" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/doors-game/images/e/e3/GALLERY.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/24?cb=20241013143559"></span></span> References</span></h2>
<div class="references-small" style="-moz-column-count: 1; -webkit-column-count: 1; column-count: 1;font-size: smaller;"><div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_ref-1"></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The Trial and Error badge originally had a similar color with no gradients, but due to losing its rarity, it was later recolored to a pink-purple gradient.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_ref-2"></a></span> <span class="reference-text">This is only given to developers of Doors. Very few people have this achievement. </span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_ref-3"></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://twitter.com/LightningSplash/status/1698134946840236299?t=6HL8yojwbHMAdcU64s8U2g&amp;s=19">Roblox gave us a warning for this badge... to be fair the guy did look naked, hopefully our new icon works better! -LSPLASH, X (Formerly Twitter)</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_ref-4"></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external free" href="https://www.roblox.com/badges/2143218889/Survival-The-Jeff-The-Killer">https://www.roblox.com/badges/2143218889/Survival-The-Jeff-The-Killer</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><a href="https://doors-game.fandom.com/wiki/Achievements#cite_ref-5"></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" class="external text" href="https://twitter.com/LightningSplash/status/1686110876007346176?t=1m5BXQiizM5CedB3q6_FpA&amp;s=19">void buster is the first secret achievement (a-1000 is close but it's revealed once you beat the rooms), there probably won't be any more secret achievements unless they don't count towards progression -LSPLASH, X (Formerly Twitter)</a></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

article, aside, details, figcaption, figure, footer, header, hgroup, menu, nav, section { display: block; }

html { box-sizing: border-box; }

*, ::after, ::before { box-sizing: inherit; }

body { line-height: 1; }

ol, ul { list-style: none; }

blockquote, q { quotes: none; }

blockquote::after, blockquote::before, q::after, q::before { content: none; }

.wds-avatar__button { appearance: none; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); border: none; color: inherit; cursor: pointer; font: inherit; height: 100%; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; width: 100%; }

.wds-avatar__image:hover { color: var(--wds-avatar-border-color--hover); }
